<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/a8b8af19e48e1803e20a129e9aebab1aac544956|patch 8.2.2262: Vim9: converting bool to string prefixes v:>
patch 8.2.2262: Vim9: converting bool to string prefixes v:

Problem:    Vim9: converting bool to string prefixes v:.
Solution:   Do not use the v: prefix.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2262: Vim9: converting bool to string prefixes v: · vim/vim@a8b8af1
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2262: Vim9: converting bool to string prefixes v: · vim/vim@a8b8af1
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: converting bool to string prefixes v:. Solution: Do not use the v: prefix.

patch 8.2.2261: Vim9: boolean option gets string type

Problem:    Vim9: boolean option gets string type.
Solution:   Check for VAR_BOOL. (closes #7588)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5efe0e5d16db070f0ab0b944686139e597afe166|patch 8.2.2260: window resize test fails in very wide terminal>
patch 8.2.2260: window resize test fails in very wide terminal

Problem:    Window resize test fails in very wide terminal.
Solution:   Resize using the 'columns' option.  (Vladimir Lomov, closes #7592)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2260: window resize test fails in very wide terminal · vim/vim@5efe0e5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2260: window resize test fails in very wide terminal · vim/vim@5efe0e5
attachments.text: Problem: Window resize test fails in very wide terminal. Solution: Resize using the 'columns' option. (Vladimir Lomov, closes #7592)

patch 8.2.2259: Test_Executable() fails when using chroot

Problem:    Test_Executable() fails when using chroot.
Solution:   Ignore the difference between "sbin" and "bin".

patch 8.2.2257: Vim9: using -> for lambda is ambiguous

Problem:    Vim9: using -> for lambda is ambiguous.
Solution:   Stop supporting ->, must use =>.

attachments.title: patch 8.2.2257: Vim9: using -> for lambda is ambiguous · vim/vim@2949cfd
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: using -> for lambda is ambiguous. Solution: Stop supporting ->, must use =>.

patch 8.2.2256: Vim9: cannot use function( after line break in :def function

Solution:   Check for "(" after "function". (closes #7581)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/dd1f426bd617ac6a775f2e7795ff0b159e3fa315|patch 8.2.2254: Vim9: bool option type is number>
patch 8.2.2254: Vim9: bool option type is number

Problem:    Vim9: bool option type is number.
Solution:   Have get_option_value() return a different value for bool and
            number options. (closes #7583)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2254: Vim9: bool option type is number · vim/vim@dd1f426
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2254: Vim9: bool option type is number · vim/vim@dd1f426
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: bool option type is number. Solution: Have get_option_value() return a different value for bool and number options. (closes #7583)
